t: Amazons - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - The Amazons (Ancient Greek: Ἀμαζόνες Amazónes, singular Ἀμαζών Amazōn; in Latin Amāzon, -ŏnis) were a people in Greek mythology, portrayed in a number of ancient epic poems and legends, such as the Labours of Heracles, the Argonautica and the Iliad.

t: Sacagawea: Native American Hero (Legendary Heroes of the Wild West): Sanford, William R., Green, Carl R.: 9780894906756: Amazon.com: Books
s: Grade 3-5. Fine scholarship undeservedly wrapped in a tacky package. Sacagawea shines as a simply written, well-documented introduction to the Shoshone woman who acted as a guide for Lewis and Clark.

t: Uncontacted Indigenous Peoples of Brazil
s: At risk of genocide from disease and land theft In the depths of the Amazon rainforest in Brazil live Indigenous people who have no contact with the outside world. Illegal loggers and cattle ranchers are invading their land and bringing disease. They won’t survive unless this stops.

s: October 17, 2014 - In some archaeological digs in Eurasia, as many as thirty-seven per cent of the graves contain the bones and weapons of horsewomen who fought alongside men.

t: Amazon celebrates Native American Heritage Month
s: Amazon's Indigenous affinity group—an inclusive community of Indigenous employees and allies— is dedicated to making an internal and external impact that celebrates and elevates diverse Indigenous cultures from around the world through culturally aware technologies, services, and marketplaces.
